result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mayta Montelongo in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-333, 15CT-197 and 15CM-417.

11:22 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing hearing today.

There is a plea agreement.

15CT-197: Defendant will plead to Count 1
15CM-417 would be dismissed and read in
16CM-333: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2
Count 3 would be dismissed and read in

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT-197: Count 1: NO CONTEST
16CM-333: Count 1: NO CONTEST
16CM-333: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CT-197: Found Guilty
15CM-417: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-333: Count 1: Found Guilty
16CM-333: Count 2: Found Guilty
16CM-333: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Address is verified.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CT-197:
Pay a fine of $100 and costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan today

16CM-333:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $150 and costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan today

Count 2:
Pay a fine of $150 and costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan today
